intro: Cynanchum taiwanianum, commonly known as the Taiwan milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite and ovate in shape. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Cynanchum taiwanianum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry environments.
